author: yojo
title: Distributed Autonomous Accelerator
description: O modelo de acelerador típico não está adaptado a um sistema distribuído global e a comunidades estruturalmente subrepresentadas.

f6_assessments.q0: A declaração do problema e a premissa deste projeto é clara, eles procuram abordar a desigualdade estrutural inerente ao modelo do acelerador através da realização de pesquisas sobre o impacto das equipes que são nutridas não por seu "potencial unicórnio", mas por resultados de benefício social. A criação do Distributed Autonomouse Accelleroator (DAA) será co-criada por esta equipe e se propõe a ajudar Cardano a aumentar a colaboração humana para tornar o mundo um lugar melhor. A equipe optou por utilizar o licenciamento aberto, de modo que a ampliação desta idéia está aberta a outros também.
f6_assessments.q1:
O projeto envolve um grande envolvimento da comunidade, pesquisa e documentação. A equipe por trás deste projeto já identificou uma série de projetos na F7 que eles gostariam de apoiar até a realização e documentação deste processo. A equipe do projeto parece sólida e tem uma gama de habilidades complementares e experiência em Cardano, um financiador que seria realmente benéfico para os projetos a serem explorados.

O orçamento e o cronograma são realmente claros, há um compromisso sério de consulta profunda com a comunidade e a co-criação que, considerando onde o Cardano está na vida seria extremamente benéfico para capturar esta pesquisa e processo por direito próprio.
f6_assessments.q2: A comunidade estaria aparentemente envolvida e convidada a participar da criação deste DAA, de modo que seria capaz de acompanhar o progresso dessa forma. A equipe também se comprometeu a apresentar relatórios no After Town Halls e se envolver diretamente com as reuniões estabelecidas, etc. Os KPI's e os resultados destes projetos são claros, assim como os marcos para o projeto. O acompanhamento do sucesso da entrega não seria um problema, pois o cronograma é claramente mapeado e anexado aos KPIs específicos e poderia ser facilmente adaptado e modificado dependendo dos resultados ou da influência da pesquisa durante todo o projeto.

f6_assessments.q0:
It's a very ambitious idea to basically overhaul the entire accelerator model. Yet, this is just one perspective - an initial non-academic study with a very limited scope - that MIGHT lead to something in the future.

Proposed solution: "Conduct a research project for a radical decentralized blockchain accelerator that nurtures teams that are worth investing in any context."

If I understood this correctly, it means focusing on the team more than their business idea. That is a very wise approach.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is really good but only partly available. Essentially the budget pays for the team's time (in total: 2 people's full-time effort for 3 months). One month per person cost is quite high: $9,167 USD. The actual design and implementation of the DAA is not covered with this; only the research.

Readiness to collaborate with other teams is admirable. One more initiative missing from the list is the Strategy Framework (https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/382562-48088), that this and other accelerators will hopefully get to utilize in the future.

The linked website http://incommons.love/ is unreachable.
f6_assessments.q2: The plan outlines the deliverables and methods how the study is conducted. It is done in close collaboration with other teams and the community in general so following up on the team's progress should be fairly easy. Definitely an auditable and easy to measure approach.

f6_assessments.q0:
Proposal performs research on how to accelerate funded proposals by complementing different information to specific areas and sort of provides guidelines. 

It is a great idea, yet it is questionable if the research will bring the expected outcome.

I find this proposal in strong accordance with the challenge goal, yet any type of research proposal is having a question mark on its outcome, thus decreasing the effectiveness score.

Rating given 4.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team is stating relevant experience and skills required to implement the proposal.

The budget is in accordance with the scale of the proposal, which seems reasonable. 

The roadmap is provided at a more than sufficient level, which is nice to see and provides a solid base.

Rating given 5.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal contains relevant KPIs and the roadmap. Both of these are sufficient for audit. 

Rating given 5.

f6_assessments.q0: According to the proposal, the purpose is to conduct a research project for a radical decentralized blockchain accelerator that guides teams. They seek to accelerate and enable projects that intend to deliver public goods with many different kinds of returns, many of which have no place in the current portfolios. The challenge is addressed effectively.
f6_assessments.q1: The team of 4 experts who are Designer, Impact Engineer, Impact Entrepreneur, Mentor, Systems Software Engineer, Business Project Organizer and they are capable of implementing the proposal successfully. The plan mentioned , among others, research and articulate the requirements needed to deliver a Distributed Autonomous Accelerator that acknowledges blockchain; set up project management and framework to communicate ; Create documentation and knowledge resource repository; Describe the roadmap to activation. which will all make implementation successful.
f6_assessments.q2: Some measurable KPIs are recruitment of initial 10 Catalyst thought leaders; 12 meetups; 2 After Town halls; 20 interviews; The road map is 12 months of work duration with different schedules; the budget is broken down effectively, which will make auditing effective.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal outlines a problem which perfectly aligns with the challenge setting. The solution is broken down into multiple steps in the 'think big, start mall' way. In the short term the funded projects do not benefit from this proposal. In the long term this approach has the potential to become a game changer for Catalyst funded projects.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer provides a long list of evidence to show required skills, experience and reputation needed to start with execute and deliver the proposed solution. 
The proposal starts in an agile way and includes in a step-wise approach huge parts of the community. The roadmap is realistic and explains planned activities and results after 1, 3, 6 and 12 months. To open the potential for the long-term it also foresees the licensing of the elaborated solution. The budget is assigned to roles (2 FTEs) and reasonable for people in a very senior level.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer provides a detailed insight what they intend to do. The description is understandable and aims to solve the problem. The KPIs are clear and help solve the challenge's setting. What could be improved is a more defined picture of the deliverables, although is is highly depended on the research outcome.

solution: Conduzir um projeto de pesquisa para um acelerador de cadeia de bloqueio descentralizado radical que nutre equipes que valem a pena investir em qualquer contexto.
experience: Há mais de uma década, estamos executando programas de incubação e aceleração de empresas. Aconselhamos startups & co-fundadores de empreendimentos fintech.
